item.description:
WHITEWATER RAFTING on the KENNEBEC RIVER!

The Kennebec River's EXTREME BIG-WATER release is scheduled for Saturday, September 22, 2012.

The normal flow of the Kennebec is about 5,000 cubic feet per second (cfs), offering some of the most exciting whitewater all summer.

However, on this day the flow will increase to a giant 8,000 cfs! making for one of the most thrilling rides possible.

These trips are the largest events of the year and not only include a massive whitewater experience sure to thrill any paddler but also an excellent BBQ and Lobster/Clam bake to complete your Maine Whitewater experience. Your day will end with a slide and video presentation of you and your friends or family conquering the biggest rapids of the summer, with live music afterward.

This is an event that will create memories to last a life time!

Don't miss it!

We'll stay overnight in nice, rustic cabins (on beds with mattresses. Hotel rooms available for extra cost.) Then we'll have a full day of the most exciting whitewater you're ever likely to see!

Snacks and a full BBQ & Lobster bake afterward are included. There is also a live band on Saturday night.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Price per person: $179 (plus meetup fee of $6)

Includes: Friday night's lodging; a full day of rafting; river snacks; BBQ & Lobster dinner; video presentation; and live music.

Add Saturday night for an extra $35 (most people stay two nights) for a total of $220.

Payments & refunds: This weekend will probably fill up and prompt payment is necessary to reserve your spot. Please check your schedule & finances and then quickly make the decision to come rather than putting it off. I will wait until several people have paid and then send money to the outfitter. Due to the popularity of this event, they do not provide refunds once payment is made.

*If wetsuits are necessary, the outfitter rents them for an additional fee. Trips run rain or shine.

Cabins: Four-bunk cabins. Mattress provided. Bring a sleeping bag.

Additional note on costs: the rafting companies charge a little more for these big-release trips and that's reflected in the price. However, you've got to ask yourself, "Even though I live so close to some of the best whitewater in the country, how often am I likely to do this?" ~Let's go for it!

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Location/Time: The Forks is 3.5 hrs from Portsmouth. Pre-trip registration is promptly at 8:30am on Saturday so staying over on Friday night is necessary. Most folks stay Saturday night as well to celebrate their adventure and to enjoy the lively atmosphere, but it's not required.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Liability Release

AS A CONDITION OF ATTENDING THIS MEETUP, YOU AGREE TO hold harmless, and indemnify the organizer and his heirs, and all members and participants of the Seacoast Outdoors Meetup group from any and all claims for injury, illness, death, and/or property damage including those caused by negligence, ignorance, inexperience and other reasons. You also agree to assume all mental, physical, financial, and/or other risk associated with this meetup. Whitewater rafting, kayaking, camping, hiking, bicycling, snow sports, alcohol consumption, and other activities pose inherent risks and dangers. Participation in these activities is voluntary and dependent upon your own personal judgment.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

OTHER IMPORTANT DETAILS!

Carpool: Please let me know if you'd like to carpool from Dover/Portsmouth at 1 pm.

Check IN anytime after 1pm. Check Out - 11am.

Bunk House lodging does not include linens. Please bring your own sleeping bag, sheets, blankets, pillows, towels - and a flashlight/head lamp.

What to Bring: Bathing Suit or Nylon Shorts, Fleece, Polypropylene or Nylon Shirt or Jacket, Extra Footwear (Tevas or Old Sneakers), Water Bottle, sunscreen - NO COTTON!

Wetsuits: Depending on the water/air temp, wetsuits may be needed. Bring your own or rent for $15.

Friday: arrive anytime - dinner on your own or with the group. We'll try and coordinate closer to the date.

Breakfast: 7-9am - Full buffet for $7 pp. (or bring your own).

Rafting: Registration - 8 AM (Changed from 9am)

Trip return time is approx. 2:30 - 3:00 pm.

Lobster/Clambake/BBQ (including steak, chicken, veggie burgers) immediately following w/ video show. Included in price.

Post-trip activities should finish up by 4:00 - 4:30 pm.

Live Band Saturday evening

Sunday: After breakfast, optional drive/hike to Gulf Hagas Wilderness, the 'grand canyon of maine,' for spectacular waterfalls, scenery, and one of Maine's best hikes! Here are some photos!

Driving Directions: 3.5 hours from Portsmouth.

I-95 north to exit 44 onto I-295 north, which merges with I-95 north again in Gardiner. Continue and take exit 133 (Skowhegan-Fairfield) Rt 201. Continue north on Route 201 (57.5 miles) through Skowhegan, Solon and Bingham. Approximately 20 miles after leaving the town of Bingham watch for the flashing moose sign. From there, you are exactly 4.8 miles from your destination.

(GPS may be unreliable)
item.name: WHITEWATER RAFTING!!
